title: Germany’s POLARIS Spaceplanes Secures €5.4M in New Funding
summary:
POLARIS Spaceplanes has secured €5.4 million in new funding through an oversubscribed top-up to its recent seed round. Founded in 2019, POLARIS Spaceplanes is developing a multipurpose spaceplane and hypersonic transport system called AURORA. With the addition of an expendable upper stage, the spaceplane is designed to be capable of delivering payloads of up to […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 12-26 mission represents the 490th Falcon 9 rocket launch to date. SpaceX is targeting a liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 11:21 a.m. EDT (1521 UTC).

title: Hubble Studies a Spiral’s Supernova Scene
summary: This serene spiral galaxy hides a cataclysmic past. The galaxy IC 758, shown in this NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image, is situated 60 million light-years away in the constellation Ursa Major. Hubble captured this image in 2023. IC 758 appears peaceful, with its soft blue spiral arms curving gently around its hazy barred center. However, […]

title: CAS Space performs Kinetica-2 first stage hot fire test ahead of first launch and cargo demo
summary:
China’s CAS Space completed a hot fire test of its Kinetica-2 rocket’s first stage, targeting a maiden orbital launch later this year.

title: Earth from Space: East Kalimantan, Borneo
Belgian endive, meatballs and microgravity
summary: When ESA astronaut Raphaël Liégeois flies to the International Space Station, he will carry with him not only scientific experiments and mission objectives, but also a comforting memory of home in the form of two beloved Belgian dishes.
